music_usage.2: - **Youtube veya soundcloud** müziklerini sıralamak için `~>play` kullan Örneğin: `~>play https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aAolFWjGfMs` *Mantaro otomatik olarak olduğun kanala bağlanacaktır.*
music_usage.3: - **Youtube da müzik aramak için** `~>play <arama>` kullanabilirsin. Örneğin: `~>play o sen olsan bari` (Sonra numara seçmen gerekecek, sadece *numarayı yaz* man yeterli olacak!)
music_usage.4: - **Soundcloud da müzik aramak için** `~>play soundcloud <arama>` kullanabilirsin. Örneğin: `~>play soundcloud o sen olsan bari`
music_usage.5: - **Listeyi kontrol etmek için** sadece `~>queue` yazman yeterli.
music_usage.6: - **Listeden şarkı çıkarmak için** `~>removetrack` yazman yeterli olacak. Şarkının kaçıncı sırada olduğunu söylemen gerekebilir. (listeden bakabilirsin)
music_usage.10: - And lastly, to **repeat a song** use `~>repeat` and to **repeat a queue** use `~>repeatqueue`. Using `~>repeat` while repeat is on, turns it off, the same is true for `~>repeatqueue`
music_usage.11: Daha fazla bilgi için `~>help <komut adı>` kullanabilirsin. (komut adını bilgi almak istediğin komut adıyla değiştirebilirsin.)
music_usage.12: Mantaro ile müziğe doyun! Beni kullandığın için teşekkürler, şekerim.

lang.info:
%1$sSunucu dilini (kullanılabilirse) `~>opts language set <dil kodu>` kullanarak değiştirebilirsiniz. Kişisel olarak da değiştişikliğe gidebilirsiniz! `~>profile lang <kişisel>` kullan.
**Kullanılabilen diller:** `%2$s`
Eğer diliniz burada yoksa, bize yardımcı olabilirsiniz, çevirmen ekibimize katılın!

season.info:
*Season* genellikle üyelerin, 6 ay içerisinde birbirleriyle top 10 listesinde para veya rep için kapıştıkları zamandır. Kazananlar ödül veya arma ödüllerini kazanırlar.
Bu daha yarışma havası yaratır. (öncesinde, paranın pek önemi olmuyordu) ve oyunu daha eğlenceli hale getirir.
Sezon işlemlerine `-season` komutunu kullanarak erişebilirsin. Profile, mine, fish ve balance komutları bunları gerektirecek, Oyunlar, loot veya rep zaten hem sezon hem genel profiline etki eder.
season.info_2:
**%1$s** şu anki sezon ve **%2$s** kadar insan bu sezonda yarışıyor!

Eğlence başlasın, `~>leaderboard money -season` yazarak leaderboardlara bakabilirsin; `~>leaderboard rep -season` ve `~>leaderboard games -season` da kullan.
Oyun! <3
Teşekkürler.

%1$sThe default prefixes are %2$s and mentioning the bot (I respond to any of those!). %3$s.

If you have any questions, you can join <https://support.mantaro.site>

ls.description:
**Bu sunucunun tüm özel (yetkilinin komutlarını) gösterir.** Buradaki komutlar genel bot yapısıyla ilgili değil, sunucu ile ilgilidir.

Özel komutlar kullancılar tarafından oluşturulur (genelde yetkililer) bu komutlar onlar tarafından kullanılır ve ona göre şekillenir.
Özel komut yapmak için bu siteden yararlanabilirsiniz (https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Custom-Commands)
 
**Liste:**
ls.footer: Bu sunucudaki toplam özel komut sayısı: %1$s

custom.invalid: %1$sInvalid command selection. Maybe take a look at the wiki at <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Custom-Commands-101>.

view.not_found: %1$sO isimde bir özel komut burada yok.
view.less_than_specified: %1$sBu komut sizin girdiğiniz cevaptan daha az cevap içeriyor...

raw.too_large_view: Too large to view here, use `~>custom view %1$s %2$s`
raw.description: Bu, bu komutun tüm yanıtlarının ham halindeki (komuta ne girdiyseniz) bir listesidir.

clear.success: %1$s**Cleared %2$d Custom Commands**. Locked/Pinned commands weren't deleted, unlock them first if you want to.

make.start_text:
%1$sBaşlatıldı **"Özel komut oluşturma `%2$s`"**!
`&~>stop` kullanarak durdurabilirsin **bu komutu kayıt etmez**.
`&~>save` kullanarak durduabilirsin. **ancak bu yeni komutu kayıt eder**. `&` ile başlayan herhangi bir cevap gönderirseniz bu komutlara eklenir. `~>nsfw` kullanırsanız bu NSFW olarak işaretlenir ve `~>sfw` yaparsanız bunu geri alırsınız.
Bu interaktif aktivite 60 saniye sonra sona erecektir.
make.no_responses_added: %1$sHerhangi bir cevap eklenmedi. Bu yüzden bu komut kayıt edilmeyecek...
make.no_name_specified: %1$sYaratmak istediğin özel komut için bir isim belirlememişsiniz!

eval.not_specified: Değerlendirmek için herhangi bir şey belirtmediniz.

import.not_found:
%1$sThere are no custom commands matching your search query.
**This command might not work properly!**
In such cases, you can manually copy the command using the output of `~>custom raw` instead.
import.note: (Sadece üyesi olduğun sunuculardan özel komut seçebilirsin)
import.success: `%1$s` özel komutu `%2$s` sunucusundan toplamda %3$d yanıt ile birlikte aktarıldı.

deleteresponse.no_responses_left: %1$sThere were no responses left, so I removed the command.

rename.not_enough_args: %1$sYou need to specify the command you want to rename and the new name.

add.not_enough_args: %1$sEklemek istediğin komutun ismini ve yanıtını belirtmeniz gerekir.
add.too_many_responses: %1$sThere's too many responses (%2$s) on this command. This limit is double (up to 100) for premium servers (Check <https://patreon.com/mantaro>)
add.too_many_commands: %1%sBu sunucuda çok fazla komut var, bu yüzden daha fazlasını ekleyemezsiniz (+100).  Bu kısıtlama premium sunucuları etkilemez.(<https://patreon.com/mantaro> adresini kontrol edin).

lockcommand.no_permission: %1$sYou need the Manage Server permission to lock and unlock commands.
lockcommand.no_command: %1$sYou need to specify the command you want to lock.
lockcommand.success: %1$sSuccesfully locked the `%2$s` command. You'll need to unlock it for further edits.

unlockcommand.no_command: %1$sYou need to specify the command you want to unlock.
unlockcommand.success: %1$sSuccesfully unlocked the `%2$s` command. You'll need to lock it later if you want to avoid further edits.

custom.no_cc: %1$sBu sunucuda özel komut yok, sadece birazcık tozlu.
custom.admin_only:
This guild only accepts custom command creation, edits, imports and eval from administrators.
**This is now the DEFAULT setting.**
- If you want to let everyone do this, and are an admin (Bot Commander role or Manage Server permission), run `~>opts admincustom false`
custom.not_found: %1$sThere's no Custom Command `%2$s` in this Guild.
custom.invalid_image: %1$sThis command contains an invalid image, please fix...
custom.invalid_string: %1$sThe string `{%2$s}` isn't valid, or the output is longer than 2000 characters.
custom.locked_command: %1$sYou can't edit or remove this command while it's locked, please run `~>custom unlockcommand <command name>` to unlock it.

mute.no_permissions: %1$sYou need to have either ban or kick members permission to mute.
mute.no_mute_role: %1$sThe mute role is not set in this server, you can set it by doing `~>opts muterole set <role>`
mute.null_mute_role: %1$sThe previously configured mute role on this server is now non-existent.
mute.no_users: %1$sYou need to give me an user to mute.
mute.no_manage_roles: %1$sI don't have permissions to administrate roles on this server.
mute.time_not_specified: %1$sYou wanted time but didn't specify for how long.
mute.time_not_specified_generic: %1$sYou didn't specify any time. For example, if you want to mute for 20 minutes you should do `~>mute 20m @mention reason goes here`, for example.
mute.negative_time_notice: %1$sYou cannot mute someone for negative time. Unless you can bend space-time that is.
mute.default_time_too_long: %1$sThe default mute timeout length is too long (Maximum: 10 days)...
mute.time_too_little:
%1$sThe specified mute timeout length is less than 10 seconds.
You sure you used the right format? For 20 minutes, use 20m, for 1 hour, use 1h, or any combination of both (1h45m) for example.
mute.time_too_long: %1$sThe specified mute timeout length is too long (Maximum: 10 days)...
mute.already_muted: %1$sThis user already has a mute role assigned. Please do `~>unmute` to un-mute them.
mute.self_hierarchy_error: %1$sI cannot assign the mute role to this user because they're in a higher hierarchy than me, or the role is in a higher hierarchy!
mute.user_hierarchy_error: %1$sI cannot assign the mute role to this user because they're in a higher hierarchy than me, or the role is in a higher hierarchy than you!
mute.success_reason: %1$sAdded mute role to **%2$s** for %3$s because of the following reason: %4$s

unmute.no_permissions: %1$sYou need to have either ban or kick members permission to un-mute!
unmute.no_mentions: %1$sYou need to mention at least one user to un-mute.
unmute.no_role_assigned: %1$sThis user doesn't have the mute role assigned to them.

love.yourself_note: Sen dünyanın en harika insanısın, kendini biraz daha sev <3

loveletter.no_letter: %1$sYou have no love letters in your inventory, so you don't have anything to write your letter on. A love letter is given to you upon marriage.
loveletter.already_done: %1$sThis marriage already has a love letter assigned. Check it using `~>marry status`
loveletter.cannot_see: %1$sEvli olduğunuz kullanıcıyı bulamadım... Büyük ihtimal benimle aynı sunucu da değiller.
loveletter.confirmation: %1$sBu mektubu **%2$s#%3$s** ile yazmak istediğinize emin misiniz? Bu evliliğiniz boyunca kalıcı olacak. *Mektup içeriği:* %4$s
loveletter.confirmed: %1$sSuccessfully delivered the love letter to your loved one! Check it using `~>marry status`
loveletter.scrapped: %1$sAcele gerek yok, hala yazmak için zamanınız var!

status.no_marriage: %1$sYou aren't married, so I guess your status is uh... "not married" (If you see a marriage in your profile and see this message that means you are in the old system, try remarrying)

timezone.no_content: %1$sYou need to specify what timezone you want this marriage to track.
timezone.invalid: %1$sNot a valid timezone or Zone ID.
timezone.success: %1$sSuccessfully set marriage timezone to %2$s. Pet time will be the same as the marriage timezone.

buyhouse.not_married: %1$sYou can only buy a house while you're married. This might change in the future.
buyhouse.no_house: %1$sYou need a house item in your inventory. Use `~>buy house` to get one.
buyhouse.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to buy a house. (Current house price: %2$d credits)
buyhouse.no_name: %1$sYou need to give your house a name! For example, `~>marry house cozy house`
buyhouse.confirm: %1$sAre you sure you wanna buy this house? The price deducted from your wallet is %2$d and the name you gave the house is %3$s. Type `yes` to confirm and `no` to cancel.
buyhouse.success: %1$sYou successfully bought a house for %2$d credits. The name of your new cozy house is %3$s, enjoy!

buycar.no_car: %1$sYou need to buy a car first! Use `~>buy car` to get one.
buycar.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to buy a car. (Current car price: %2$d credits)
buycar.no_name: %1$sYou need to give your car a name! For example, `~>marry car vroom`
buycar.confirm: %1$sAre you sure you wanna buy this car? The price deducted from your wallet is %2$d and the name you gave the car is %3$s. Type `yes` to confirm and `no` to cancel.
buycar.success: %1$sYou successfully bought a car for %2$d credits. The name of your new fast car is %3$s, enjoy!

marry.no_mention: %1$sMention the user you want to marry.
marry.marry_yourself_notice: %1$sYou cannot marry yourself, as much as you may want to.
marry.marry_bot_notice: %1$sYou cannot marry a bot. I don't think this is Futurama... yet. Wait, could bots and humans marry there?
marry.no_ring: %1$sYou cannot propose without two marriage rings! You can buy them by doing `~>buy 2 ring` and then try proposing again <3
marry.confirmation:
%1$s%2$s, type with **yes** or **no** to the marriage proposal from %3$s
%4$sThis timeouts in 120 seconds.
marry.ring_check_fail: %1$sYou cannot marry with less than two rings on your inventory :(
marry.ratelimit_message: Why would you want to marry this much?

divorce.confirm: %1$sAre you sure you want to end this marriage? The money spent in pets, houses and cars will be split in two. Type `yes` to continue and `no` to cancel. **Your pet will dissapear, since it's tied to the marriage**
divorce.not_married:
%1$sYou aren't married with anyone, why don't you find that special someone?
Wanna unclaim a Waifu? Use `~>waifu unclaim` instead.
divorce.success:
%1$sNow you're single. That's nice I guess.
%2$s
divorce.split: The money left was split between the two parties by selling their assets (pet, house, car). Each one got **%1$d** credits on their wallet.

waifu.bot: %1$sA bot can't be a waifu, even if you want to...
waifu.notice: This feature isn't meant to have any kind of relationship, either implicit or explicit, with real life events.

stats.format:
%1$s **Money weight value:** %2$,d
%1$s **Badge weight value:** %3$,d
%1$s **Experience weight value:** %4$,d
%1$s **Claim weight value:** %5$,d
%1$s **Reputation multiplier:** %6$.2fx

claim.no_user: %1$sYou didn't mention any user to claim.
claim.locked: %1$sYou're currently unable to perform this action.
claim.key_locked: %1$sThe user you tried to claim is key-locked and cannot be claimed. They can remove it using `~>profile claimlock remove` if they wish to do so.
claim.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to claim this waifu **(Cost: %2$s)**
claim.not_enough_slots: %1$sYou don't have enough slots available to claim this waifu. (Total slots: %2$s, Used slots: %3$s)
claim.not_found: %1$sI can't find any user with this query.

unclaim.no_user: %1$sYou need to mention a waifu to un-claim.
unclaim.confirmation:
%1$sAre you *sure* you want to un-claim %2$s? The cost to un-claim this waifu is **%3$s credits**. Type *yes* to confirm or *no* to cancel
%4$sThis times out in 1 minute.
unclaim.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to un-claim this waifu!
unclaim.player_locked: %1$sYou cannot do this at the moment.
unclaim.success: %1$sSuccessfully unclaimed `%2$s` with a cost of **%3$s credits**.
unclaim.not_found: %1$sI can't find any user with this query. If you need to unclaim an unknown user, use their ID (`~>waifu -id`) and append `-unknown` at the end.

buyslot.locked: %1$sYou're currently unable to perform this action.
buyslot.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to buy more slots! You need %2$d credits.
buyslot.success: %1$sSuccessfully bought this slot for %2$s credits, you currently have %3$s total slots and %4$s available slots.
buyslot.too_many: %1$sYou already have too many slots! The maximum is 30 slots.

optout.notice: %1$sYou've opted out of the entire waifu system, so you can't use this.
optout.warning:
%1$sDo you want to opt-out from the waifu system? THIS IS PERMANENT AND CAN'T BE REVERTED. Seriously.
If you only want to be opted out of new claims and wanna use the waifu system as usual, please use `~>profile claimlock` instead.
You won't be able to claim or be claimed, and all the claims over you will be removed.
Type `Yes, I want to opt out of the waifu system completely and irreversibly` or `no`. Typing the confirmation message will opt you out, no will cancel it.
optout.success: %1$sYou successfully opted out of the waifu system.
optout.claim_notice: %1$sThe user you're trying to claim opted out.
optout.lookup_notice: %1$sThe user you're trying to lookup opted out.

waifu.description_header:
Here's a list with all of your beloved waifus, sorted by addition date.
*You can have a maximum of %1$d waifus as of now.*

If you wish to check your waifu stats, use `~>waifu stats`
waifu.no_waifu:
No waifus to see here, just dust :(
You can get waifus by claiming someone! Use `~>waifu claim` to get started.

coinflip.over_limit: %1$sHold in there! The limit is 1,000 coin flips
coinflip.no_repetitions: %1$sYou need to specify an Integer for the amount of repetitions (For example, `~>roll 100`)
coinflip.success: %1$s Your result from **%2$d** time(s) yielded **%3$d** heads and **%4$d** tails

inventory.bot_notice: %1$sHere, bots have no inventory. Well, sometimes you might wish they had one but then it would only be a `~>dump`
inventory.brief:
**%1$s's item collection** %2$s

*For a detailed version, use `~>inventory -info`. Enjoy your day!*
inventory.calculate: %1$s%2$s will get **%3$d credits** if all of the items are sold.
inventory.brief_notice: You can use `~>inventory -brief` to get a mobile friendly version.

cast.no_item_specified: %1$sYou didn't specify any items. For a list, check `~>cast ls`
cast.no_item_found: %1$sI didn't find any item matching that. Make sure to type the full item name to avoid mismatches, or use the emoji if you can. Example: `~>cast star pick`
cast.item_not_cast: %1$sYou cannot cast this item. You can check `~>cast ls` for a list of castable items. Try using the full name if you think you have the correct item.
cast.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to cast this. **(Cost: %2$s)**
cast.no_item: %1$sYou don't have the necessary item *%2$s* to proceed with this cast. You need %3$,d of them.
cast.not_enough_items: %1$sYou don't have enough of item *%2$s* to proceed the cast of a **%3$s**. **(Needed: %4$s, Current: %5$s)**
cast.no_tool: %1$sYou need to have a %2$s to proceed with this cast!
cast.not_equipped:
%1$sYou don't have any equipped wrench. Use `~>equip <wrench name>` to equip a wrench and start your adventure! If you don't have any, first run `~>buy wrench`.
You don't have to specify the wrench used in this command anymore. To cast multiple items, put the number before the item name, for example: `~>cast 5 star pick`
cast.too_many: %1$sYou'd have more than 5,000 of this item if you proceed. Try casting less of this object?
cast.low_tier: %1$sYou need at least a Tier 2 wrench (at least a Comet Wrench) to cast more items per call. You currently have a Tier %2$s wrench equipped.
cast.not_enough_wrench_level: %1$sYour wrench is not powerful enough to cast this item. Maybe equip a more powerful one? (*Wrench level: %2$s, Required level: %3$s*)
cast.too_many_amount: %1$sYou can't cast that many of this item at once! Limit: %2$s, Attempt: %3$s. A sparkle wrench makes the limit double! Unless you're already using one.

autoequip.success: %1$sAutomatically equipped a **%2$s** on your wrench slot.

ls.desc:
This is a list of the items you can cast using `~>cast`.
You can use full name or the short name, or the emoji.
**Casting has a minimum cost of half the price of the item, which is shown below.**.
Wrench tier 2 and 3 are comet and sparkle, respectively.

cast.dust: %1$sYou cannot cast with such a dusty inventory! *(Dust level: %2$s%%)*. Why not clean it up using `~>useitem mop`?
cast.wrench_multiple_use: Tip: *You can't use the wrench you are trying to cast with as ingredient!*

dump.replacement: You can use `~>dump` now. For example, instead of `~>market dump floppy` you can do `~>dump floppy`. Please use the new command instead... I wonder what happened to all the floppies you all threw away?
dump.no_item: %1$sYou need to specify the amount of that item (if it's only one, you don't need to specify the amount) and the item that you want to dump.
dump.invalid: %1$sNot a valid number of items to dump.
dump.non_existent: %1$sCannot dump a non-existent item! If you're lost, you can try typing the short name or wrapping the name in quotes.
dump.player_no_item: %1$sCannot dump an item you don't have!
dump.more_items_than_player: %1$sYou cannot dump more items than what you have.

price.no_item: %1$sYou need to specify the item you want to check the price of.
price.non_existent: %1$sCannot check the price of a non-existent item. If you're lost, you can try typing the short name or wrapping the name in quotes.
price.no_price: %1$sThis item is not available neither for sell or buy (could be an exclusive collectible)
price.collectible: %1$sThis is a collectible item. (Sell value: %2$d credits)
price.success: %1$sThe market value of %2$s**%3$s** is %4$s credits to buy it and you can get %5$s credits if you sell it.

sell.replacement: You can use `~>sell` now. For example, instead of `~>market sell pick` you can do `~>sell pick`. Please use the new command instead.
sell.no_item: %1$sYou need to specify the item to sell.
sell.no_item_amount: %1$sYou need to specify the amount of that item (if it's only one, you don't need to specify the amount) and the item that you want to sell.
sell.invalid: %1$sNot a valid number of items to sell.

all.confirmation: %1$sAre you *sure* you want to sell **all** of your items? This will clear your *whole* inventory. If you wanna sell individual items please use the amount. Type *yes* to confirm and *no* to cancel
all.success: %1$sYou sold all your inventory items and gained %2$,d credits!

sell.non_existent: %1$sYou cannot sell a non-existent item. If you're lost, you can try typing the short name or wrapping the name in quotes.
sell.no_sell_price: %1$sYou cannot sell an item that cannot be sold. (But you can `~>dump` it)
sell.no_item_player: %1$sYou cannot sell an item you don't have.
sell.more_items_than_player: %1$sYou cannot sell more items than what you have.

buy.replacement: You can use `~>buy` now. For example, instead of `~>market buy pick` you can do `~>buy pick`. Please use the new command instead.
buy.no_item: %1$sYou need to specify the item to buy.
buy.no_item_amount: %1$sYou need to specify the amount of that item (if it's only one, you don't need to specify the amount) and the item that you want to buy.
buy.invalid: %1$sNot a valid number of items to buy.
buy.non_existent: %1$sYou cannot buy an non-existent item. If you're lost, you can try typing the short name or wrapping the name in quotes. Also, the item amount goes before the item name, example: `~>buy 15 energy`
buy.no_buy_price: %1$sYou cannot buy an item that cannot be bought.
buy.item_limit_reached: %1$sYou cannot buy more of that object. You can only have a maximum of 5000 of any item.
buy.success: %1$sBought %2$,d %3$s for %4$,d credits successfully. You now have %5$,d credits.
buy.success_breakable: %1$sBought %2$,d %3$s for %4$,d credits successfully. You now have %5$,d credits. You can equip this using `~>equip <item name>`
buy.success_potion: %1$sBought %2$,d %3$s for %4$,d credits successfully. You now have %5$,d credits. You can use this potion or buff using `~>useitem <item name>`
buy.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to buy this item. Current: %2$,d credits, Needed: %3$,d credits.
buy.success_breakable_upgrade: You can check <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Currency-103> for more information on how to upgrade your tools!

market.reference: You can buy and sell items using `~>buy <item>` and `~>sell <item>`. Check `~>help market` for more info, you can also see shorter market lists there, like `~>market tools`

itemtransfer.bot_notice: %1$sYou cannot transfer items to a bot.
itemtransfer.locked_notice: %1$sYou cannot transfer items now. (Player is locked)
itemtransfer.overflow: %1$sThis player has the maximum amount (5000) of this item.
itemtransfer.overflow_after: %1$sAfter transferring the item, the player would have more than the maximum amount (5000) of this item.
itemtransfer.multiple_items_error: %1$sYou don't have any of these items in your inventory
itemtransfer.error: %1$sYou don't have enough of this item in your inventory to do this!
itemtransfer.no_item_mention: %1$sYou need to specify the person to transfer the item to and the item to transfer.

transfer.new_account_notice_yourself: %1$sYour account must be at least 14 days old to transfer money.
transfer.new_account_notice_other: %1$sThe account you're transferring to must be at least 14 days old.
transfer.bot_notice: %1$sYou cannot transfer money to a bot.
transfer.no_amount: %1$sYou need to specify the amount. Use the `transferitems` command instead if you meant to transfer an item.
transfer.over_transfer_limit: %1$sYou cannot transfer this much money. (Limit: %2$d credits)
transfer.receipt_overflow_notice: Cannot send money to this player.
transfer.no_money_notice: %1$sYou cannot transfer money you don't have.
transfer.receipt_over_limit: %1$sThis user already has too much money...
transfer.item_transfer: %1$sYou cannot transfer items using transfer, use the `~>transferitems` command instead.
transfer.party: You can only transfer to the same person (%1$s) once every 10 minutes.

ls.desc: This is a list of all interactive items in Mantaro. For more info about interactive items check the wiki!

useitem.use_command: %1$sFor this item you need to use the command that's linked to the item! (mine for pick, fish for the fishing rod)
useitem.no_items_specified: %1$sYou need to specify what item to use.
useitem.interactive_no_action: %1$sThis item has been marked as interactive, but has no action set. This item might use its own command? For example, picks use `~>mine`
useitem.no_item: %1$sYou don't have this item in your inventory.
useitem.not_enough_items: %1$sYou don't have enough of this item.
useitem.invalid_amount: %1$sThe amount needs to be a valid number between `1` and `15`!

opts.note:
%1$sHey, if you're lost or want help on using opts, check <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Configuration> for a guide on how to use opts.
Note: Only administrators, people with Manage Server or people with the Bot Commander role can use this command!

list.header:
**Mantaro's Options List**
%1$s*All options must be prefixed with `~>opts` when running them*
%2$s

8ball.no_args: %1$sYou need to specify what you want the 8ball to answer.
8ball.error: %1$sI ran into an error while fetching the 8ball results.

list.name: Autorole name:
list.no_autoroles: There aren't any autoroles setup in this server.
list.description: This are the current user-assignable auto roles on this server. You can use these by doing `~>iam <name of the role>`

iam.deleted_role: %1$sThe role that this autorole corresponded to has been deleted
iam.error: %1$sI couldn't take from you **%2$s**. Make sure that I have permission to add roles (Manage Roles) and that my role is above **%2$s**
iam.no_role: %1$sThere isn't an autorole with the name `%2$s`
iam.no_iam: %1$sYou need to specify which auto-assignable role you want to assign yourself!

iamnot.no_args: %1$sYou have to specify what role you want me to remove from you, silly.

poll.missing:
%1$sYou didn't include either the %2$s argument or it was empty!
%3$s
poll.invalid:
%1$sThis poll cannot build. **Remember that the options must be a maximum of 9 and a minimum of 2 and the timeout must be a maximum of 45m and a minimum of 30s.**
Options are separated with a comma, for example `1,2,3` (no spaces between them!). For spaced stuff use quotation marks at the start and end of the sentence. If you're really lost, there's an example on `~>help poll`
poll.other_poll_running: %1$sThere seems to be another poll running here...
poll.no_reaction_perms: %1$sSeems like I cannot add reactions here...
poll.too_long: %1$sThis was too long to show. Try with less options?
poll.success:
**Poll started. React to the number to vote.**
*%1$s*
Type &cancelpoll to cancel a running poll.
poll.error: %1$sAn unknown error has occurred while setting up a poll. Maybe try again? (içsel bir hata)
poll.result_screen: **Showing results for the poll started by %1$s** with name: *%2$s*
poll.incorrect_time_format: %1$sIncorrect time format. Remember, the proper time format it's a number followed by `h, m or s` (hours, minutes or seconds). Example: `-time 40m`

timezone.not_specified: %1$sYou need to specify the timezone. A valid timezone would be, for example `GMT-3` or `America/Chicago` (ZoneId).
timezone.invalid: %1$sInvalid timezone. A valid timezone would be, for example `GMT-3` or `America/Chicago` (ZoneId). Usually you can get your timezone by looking up "what timezone am I in"

claimlock.success: %1$sYou can't be waifu claimed anymore. This used up a claim key. Use `~>profile claimlock remove` to remove it later.

ls.desc:
This is a list of all of the currently obtainable badges on Mantaro. This list contains the name and description of the badge, which should give you a overall picture of what you need to achieve it.
If you think you got a badge and you don't see it on your personal badge list, use `~>profile` and then run `~>badges` again.
Good luck, badge hunters!

badges.profile_notice: Bir rozet kazandığını düşünüyor ve burada görmüyorsan `~>profile` yaz ve komutu tekrar çalıştır.
badges.info_notice: Use `~>badges info <badge name>` to get more information about a badge. [You can also check the wiki](https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Badge-reference-and-documentation)
badges.footer: Rozetler aynı başarımlar gibidir, botu kullandıkça veya oyunlara katıldıkça tek tek kazanılır.

cooldown.explanation: You can give reputation to one person every 12 hours. Please wait the time above before you can give reputation to someone else.

birthday.no_guild_birthdays:
%1$sThings seems a bit empty here.
Remember that cache refreshes every 23h and that now people have to run `~>birthday allowserver` to allow this server to announce their birthdays.
birthday.no_guild_month_birthdays:
%1$sThere are no birthdays for this month (%2$s) here :(
%3$sIf you just setup the birthday announcer, please wait a bit until running this again. (Cache refreshes every 23h)
Remember that now people have to run `~>birthday allowserver` to allow this server to announce their birthdays.
birthday.error: %1$sDoğum günlerini alırken bir hata oldu. (içsel bir hata) :(
birthday.header:
**%1$s's Birthdays for %2$s**
Birthday cache is updated every 23 hours, so if your birthday doesn't appear here, don't panic and wait it out. Showing up to 100 results.
birthday.full_header:
**%1$s's Birthdays**
%2$s
Remember that birthdays are cached every 23 hours and that they have to run `~>birthday allowserver`. Showing up to 100 results.
birthday.error_date:
%1$sThe date you entered is either not a valid date or I can't parse it properly. Please try with the correct formatting.
Remember that the date format is `dd/mm` (For example, use `~>birthday 16-11` for the 16th of November).
If the month or day has only one digit you need to append a 0 to it. For example, 14/7 would become 14/07 and 7/12 would become 07/12.
birthday.added_birthdate: %1$sSuccessfully added birth date. New birthday date: %2$s *(Format: dd-MM)* [day-month]. For this server to announce your birthday, you now have to run `~>birthday allowserver`%3$s
birthday.invalid_month: %1$sGeçerli bir ay değil! (Geçerli aylar 1 ve 12 arasındadır.)
birthday.no_content: %1$sYou need to specify your birthday, `remove` to reset your birthday or `month` to check the birthday month list. Then, for this server to announce your birthday, you now have to run `~>birthday allowserver`
birthday.new_format: %1$sThe new date format is just `dd-mm` (day-month, for example 20-10 as for 20th of October). No need to enter your year now, so you can omit that part.
birthday.allowed_server: %1$sAllowed the current server to announce your birthday. To deny it in the future, just run `~>birthday denyserver` on this server.
birthday.denied: %1$sDenied the current server from announcing your birthday. To allow it in the future, just run `~>birthday allowserver` on this server.
birthday.already_denied: %1$sThis server already can't announce your birthday. If you want to allow it, run `~>birthday allowserver` instead. This is the default.
birthday.leap: Your birthday is on the 29th of February, which means it'll get announced on the 29th on leap years, and on the 28th of February on non-leap years.
birthday.already_allowed: %1$sYou already allowed this server to show your birthday.

remindme.no_time: %1$sYou didn't specify the time. Try specifying it at the start of the command, for example, `~>remindme 1h do the dishes`. The format is a number followed by either d (days), h (hours), m (minutes) or s (seconds). Check `~>help mute` for an example.

pet.explanation:
Pets are a useful companion in currency!
They help you gain more money, loot more, find random stuff on mine, chop trees, and even catch fish. The higher the level, the higher the rewards!
Getting the right pet for your activities is important, so make sure to check the type and abilities of the pet you want to choose!
Remember that you need to feed your pet and give it water, aswell as let it rest and charge up in energy every once in a while, just like a real pet! You can even pat it :)
There's two types: Personal (for yourself) and Marriage (shared between your partner and you). Choose one with `~>pet choice`. The default is Personal.
For more help, use `~>help pet` and `~>pet list` for a list of pets.
pet.no_marriage: %1$sYou need to be married to have a pet. For now. Check `~>help marry` and `~>pet`
pet.no_marriage_other: %1$s%2$s needs to be married to have a pet. For now. Check `~>help marry` and `~>pet`

status.no_pet: %1$sYou don't have any pets to check the status of. Check `~>pet` for an explanation. (Choice: %2$s)%3$s
status.pet_in_other_category: %1$sYou have a pet on the %2$s choice (%3$s). You can switch to it with `~>pet choice %2$s`
status.description:
Remember to take care and love your pet :heart:
See `~>pet` and `~>help pet` for an explanation.

list.abilities:
*Fish*: Useful for `~>fish`
*Catch*: Useful for `~>mine`
*Chop*: Useful for `~>chop`
*Cheer*: Gives you a nice morale boost.

feed.not_inventory: %1$sYou don't have the item you want to feed your pet. Make sure it's in your inventory and you have the right amount (%2$s).
feed.not_applicable: %1$sYou can't feed this food to your pet type.
feed.success: %1$sYay! Succesfully fed your pet with `%2$s` x%3$s and it recovered %4$s%% of their hunger. Their hunger is now %5$s%% satisfied.
feed.too_much: %1$sMaybe give it a little less food? You'd be wasting food otherwise! (The amount used would surpass 100%% hunger)

water.no_pet: %1$sYou don't have any pets to water. Check `~>pet` for an explanation. (Choice: %2$s)%3$s
water.no_need: %1$sYour pet isn't thirsty, so they don't want to drink right now.
water.not_inventory: %1$sYou don't have a Water Bottle. Make sure it's in your inventory.
water.not_enough_inventory: %1$sYou don't have enough water bottles in your inventory! You need %2$s.
water.too_much: %1$sMaybe give it a little less water? You'd be wasting water otherwise! (The amount used would surpass 100%% thirst)
water.success: %1$sYay! Succesfully gave your pet %2$d water and it recovered %3$s%% of their thirst. Their thirst is now %4$s%% quenched.

activity.low_stamina: %1$s**%2$s** has a really low stamina. Give it food/water to replenish.
activity.low_health: %1$s**%2$s** has really low health. Give it food/water and let it rest for a while to replenish.
activity.low_hunger: %1$s**%2$s** is too hungry to do anything right now. *Fooood~*
activity.low_thirst: %1$s**%2$s** is too thirsty to do anything right now.
activity.low_mood: %1$s**%2$s** has too low of a mood. You might wanna play with them!
activity.dusty: %1$s**%2$s** is too dusty. Clean your pet to clear the dust.
activity.success_fish: %1$s**%2$s** successfully helped you catch fish! You got a buff and extra credits **(%3$,d extra credits, %4$,d extra items)** thanks to the extra work your pet was able to do for you! *included on what you got*
activity.success_chop: %1$s**%2$s** successfully helped you chop a tree! You got a buff and extra credits **(%3$,d extra credits, %4$,d extra items)** thanks to the extra work your pet was able to do for you! *included on what you got*
activity.success_mine: %1$s**%2$s** successfully helped you mine! You got a buff and extra credits **(%3$,d extra credits, and a extra item drop chance)** thanks to the extra work your pet was able to do for you! *included on what you got*

rename.no_pet: %1$sYou don't have a pet to rename. (Choice: %2$s)%3$s
rename.same_name: %1$sThe name you gave me is the same as the current name of your pet.
rename.no_content: %1$sYou need to give me the new name of your pet.
rename.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to do this. Cost: %2%s, Current: %3$s.
rename.success: %1$sSuccessfully renamed your pet from `%2$s` to `%3$s`. %4$s has been deducted from your wallet. Enjoy!

remove.no_pet: %1$sYou don't have a pet to remove. (Choice: %2$s)%3$s
remove.confirm:
%1$sAre you sure you wanna remove this pet? The person you're married to will receive %2$,d credits, and you will receive %2$,d credits aswell.
Type `yes` to confirm or `no` otherwise. Keep in mind your refund won't scale with levels or anything, so take this as buying a new tomagotchi or something similar.
remove.confirm_personal:
%1$sAre you sure you wanna remove this pet? You will receive %2$,d credits.
Type `yes` to confirm or `no` otherwise. Keep in mind your refund won't scale with levels or anything, so take this as buying a new tomagotchi or something similar.
remove.success: %1$sSuccessfully removed pet. Every person in this marriage received %2$s credits as a refund.
remove.success_personal: %1$sSuccessfully removed pet. You received %2$s credits as a refund.

info.not_found: %1$sI can't find the pet type you're looking for. Use `~>pet list` for a list of pet types.
info.author: Pet information for type %1$s%2$s
info.name: Pet Name

pet.locked_notice: %1$sYou can't buy/sell a pet when the transaction is locked. If this is an error, try again in a few minutes.

description.2: **If you have any questions about the bot, feel free to join the support guild and ask**!.
description.3: We provided a patreon link in case you would like to help Mantaro keep running by donating [and getting perks by doing so!].
description.4: Thanks you for using the bot! **<3 from the developers and the Mantaro team**

invite.footer: We hope you have fun with the bot.

salvage.no_item: %1$sYou need to specify the item you want to salvage.
salvage.no_item_found: %1$sI can't find the item you specified.
salvage.not_wrench: %1$sYou need a wrench to salvage an item. You might need to specify it manually after the item.
salvage.not_enough_level: %1$sYou need at least a level 2 wrench to salvage this item.
salvage.no_main_item: %1$sYou don't appear to have the item you're trying to salvage.
salvage.no_tool: %1$sYou don't have this wrench. Try specifying it, or specifying another wrench.
salvage.no_tool_default: %1$sYou need at least a Comet Wrench in your inventory to do this, but you can also specify a higher one if you want to.
salvage.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to salvage this item. *(Wallet: %2$,d, Needed: %3$,d)*
salvage.dust: %1$sYour inventory is too dusty to attempt a item salvage, try cleaning it with a mop.
salvage.no_returnables: %1$sThis item has no returnable salvage elements.
salvage.item_broke: %1$sYour wrench (%1$s) broke while trying to salvage this item :(
salvage.success: %1$sSuccessfully salvaged %2$s and got %3$s in return. The cost was %4$s credits.

ls.desc:
This is a list of the items you can salvage using `~>salvage`.
You can use full name, short name or the emoji
Salvaging has a cost of 1/3rd the price of the item, which is shown below.
You will only get one item of the listed here, choosen randomly.
Wrench tier 2 and 3 are comet and sparkle, respectively.

social.header: %1$sO-Oh, I see you're interested on seeing my social networks!
social.note: **If you like Mantaro, please up-vote on** <https://discordbots.org/bot/mantaro> **and/or consider donating on Patreon or Paypal! Thanks you~**

roleinfo.no_content: %1$sYou need to specify the name of the role to look for.

donate.beg:
%1$sOh hi! If you are interested in donating, please check the links below. Running Mantaro takes time and money, and every dollar is highly appreciated!

%2$s

help.title: Mantaro Help
help.base_category: Command list for category %1$s. For a detailed guide, please check the [wiki](https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki). [Currency Guide](https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Currency-101)
help.base:
**Full command list**. For a detailed guide, please check our [wiki](https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki).
Remember you can get more information on a command using `~>help <name of command>`
help.support: If you're still lost you can join the [support server](https://support.mantaro.site). You can also follow me on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mantarodiscord) for updates.
help.patreon: **[We need your help to keep Mantaro online! Click here for more info.](https://www.patreon.com/mantaro)**
help.disabled_commands: Only showing non-disabled commands. Total disabled commands: %1$s
help.channel_specific_disabled_commands: Only showing non-disabled commands. Total channel-specific disabled commands: %1$s

extended.no_help: %1$sThere's no extended help set for this command.
extended.not_found: %1$sA command with this name doesn't exist

repair.no_item: %1$sYou didn't specify any item to repair. If you think you have the correct item, try using the full name.
repair.no_item_found: %1$sI can't find that item. If you think you have the correct item, try using the full name.
repair.no_main_item: %1$sYou don't have the item you're trying to repair (%2$s)
repair.cant_repair: %1$s**%2$s** it's not an item you can repair. You can only repair broken items.
repair.no_tool: %1$sYou need a Tier 2 (at least Comet Wrench) or above wrench to repair this item. You can equip one if needed (`~>equip Comet Wrench`, for example)
repair.no_tool_specified: %1$sYou specified a wrench you don't have (%2$s). Please use a tool you have or cast it. If you think you have the correct item, try using the full name.
repair.dust: %1$sYour inventory it's too dusty to perform a repair. Dust level: %2$s
repair.not_wrench: %1$sYou can't use this as a wrench. Remember to use quotes if the name has spaces.
repair.not_enough_level: %1$sYou need a higher tier wrench to perform this repair. You can equip one if needed (`~>equip Comet Wrench`, for example)
repair.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to repair this item. *(Wallet: %2$,d, Needed: %3$,d)*
repair.no_item_recipe: %1$sYou don't have the necessary *%2$s* to perform this repair.
repair.not_enough_items: %1$sYou don't have enough of *%2$s* to perform this repair on a **%3$s**. **(Needed: %4$s, Current: %5$s)**
repair.item_broke: %1$sSadly, your wrench (%1$s) broke while repairing this item, but you still got your item!
repair.success: %1$sRepair successful! Repaired item %2$s **%3$s** -> %4$s **%5$s**. The repair cost was *%6$s* credits and the recipe to repair it was *%7$s*.

ls.desc:
This is a list of the items you can repair using `~>repair`.
You can use full name or the short name, or the emoji.
Repairing has a minimum cost of 1/3rd of the item cost, which is shown below alongside the needed materials. You need at least a Comet Wrench to repair something.

anime.no_args: %1$sYou need to tell me what anime to look for.
anime.selection_start: Type the number of the anime you want to select.
anime.information_footer: Information provided by Anilist. Type &cancel to cancel.
anime.malformed_result: %1$sI got a wrong API result for this specific search. Maybe try with another search term?
anime.error:
%1$s**I swear I didn't drop your favorite anime!**
I received a `%2$s` while trying to process the command. (internal error)
anime.timeout: %1$sWe tried to look for this anime, but the request timed out on Kitsu's end. Try again later?
anime.information_notice: Information provided by AniList. Click the title to go to AniList's page about this anime.

character.no_args: %1$sYou need to tell me what character you want to look for.
character.selection_start: Type the number of the character you want to select.
character.error:
%1$s**I swear I didn't d-drop your waifu, please forgive me!**
I got `%2$s` while trying to process this command. (internal error)

balance.new_player: Hello there! I see you might be new here. This guide will help you a lot: <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Currency-101>. This will only be shown once.
balance.reset_notice:
If you wanna know what happened to your money, read <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Money-Reset-FAQ-and-General-Statements>
You didn't lose your old money completely, it's still visible on `~>profile` :heart:
Your inventory was kept, maybe sell some stuff to get some money?
This will only be shown once. Read the page linked for more details.

daily.check: %1$sYou'll be able to claim your daily on: **%2$s.**
daily.ratelimit_message: You can run daily once a day. If you need to check, you can also use `~>daily -check`. Enjoy!

errors.bot: %1$sYou cannot transfer your daily to a bot.
errors.receipt_locked: That user cannot receive daily credits now.
errors.own_locked: You cannot receive your daily now.
errors.same_user: %1$sUse daily without mentioning yourself if you're gonna mention yourself :P

streak.first_time: First time claiming daily, have fun! (Come back for your streak tomorrow!)

lost_streak.normal: 2+ days have passed since your last daily, so your streak of `%1$dx` got reset :(
lost_streak.watch: Even your `Magical Watches` could not stop the flow for this long. Even after using all your owned magic watches your streak of `%1$dx` still ran out of time and got reset :(

streak.bonus: You won a bonus of $%1$s for claiming your daily for 5 days in a row or more! (Included on the money shown!)

given.up:
Streak up! Current streak: `%1$dx`.
*The streak was applied to your profile!*
given.bonus: %1$s won a bonus of $%2$s for claiming your daily for 5 days in a row or more! (Included on the money shown!)

streak.watch_used: Your `Magical Watches` saved your streak! You used `%1$d` of them to extend your streaks survival time to %2$dx, you have `%3$d` of them remaining!

sellout.get_premium: We need your help to keep Mantaro alive! Check <https://patreon.com/mantaro> for more info. **You can get up to twice as many credits with Premium!** Memberships start at only $2/month, the price of cheap snack!
sellout.already_premium: Thank you for supporting Mantaro. Without help from people like you we couldn't keep Mantaro alive :heart:

daily.crate: You won a loot crate because your daily streak it's a multiple of 20! Enjoy.
daily.watch_get: You won a `Magic Watch` because your daily streak is a multiple of 50! Enjoy.

gamble.no_credits: %1$sYou're broke. Maybe search for some credits first.
gamble.too_much_money: %1$sYou have too much money! Maybe transfer or buy items? Now you can also use `~>slots` for all your gambling needs! Thanks for not breaking the local bank. *(Gamble absolute limit: %2$d credits)*
gamble.invalid_money_or_modifier: %1$sPlease type a valid number less than or equal to your current balance or `all` to gamble all your credits.
gamble.not_enough_money: %1$sPlease type a value within your balance.
gamble.confirmation_message: %1$sYou're about to bet **%2$d** credits (which seems to be a lot). Are you sure? Type **yes** to continue and **no** otherwise.
gamble.win: %1$sCongrats, you won %2$d credits and got to keep what you had.
gamble.win_overflow: %1$sCongrats, you won %2$d credits. But you already had too many credits. Your bag overflowed.
gamble.too_much: %1$sYou can only gamble up so much at once. You don't want to go full broke do you? *(Gamble single limit: %2$,d credits)*
gamble.too_little: %1$sYou cannot gamble so little money (Minimum: 100 credits)

loot.item_overflow: But you already had too many items, so you decided to throw away the excess.

with_item.found: %1$sDigging through messages, you found %2$s, along with **$%3$d credits!** %4$s
with_item.found_but_overflow: %1$sDigging through messages, you found %2$s, along with **$%3$d credits.**%4$sBut you already had too many credits, so I donated the excess.

without_item.found_but_overflow_no_item: %1$sDigging through messages, you found **$%2$d credits.** But you already had too many credits, so I donated the excess.

loot.dust: Digging through messages, you found nothing but dust (Dust level %1$s%%)
loot.easter: Seems like you've got so much dust here... You might want to clean this up before it gets too messy!

mine.not_equipped: %1$sYou don't have any equipped pick. Use `~>equip <pick name>` to equip a pick and start your adventure! If you don't have any pick, first run `~>buy pick`
mine.no_pick: %1$sYou don't have any pick to mine. If you want to use any other pick use `~>mine <pick name>`
mine.not_suitable: %1$sThis is not a pick you can use to mine!
mine.not_in_inventory: %1$sYou don't have this pick on your inventory, switching to the default pick.
mine.success: %1$sYou mined minerals worth **$%2$s credits**, using a *%3$s*
mine.reminder:
*You can cast better picks using the gems you get while mining. Check `~>cast ls` for a list of things you can cast*
For a guide on how to upgrade your tools, give this a read: <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Currency-103>

diamond.overflow: Huh, you found %1$s diamond(s) while mining, but you already had too much, so I sold it for you.
diamond.success: Huh! You got lucky and found a diamond while mining, check your inventory!

gem.overflow: Huh, you found *%1$s* while mining, but you already had too much of that gem, so I sold it for you.
gem.success: Huh! You got lucky and found *%1$s* while mining, check your inventory.
gem.success_extra: Hurray! You got extra lucky and found *%1$s* and *%2$s* while mining, check your inventory.

sparkle.overflow: You found a sparkling gem, but it seems like you had too much of it already, so we sold it for you.
sparkle.success: Hurray! You found one %1$s sparkling gem. Make sure to keep it around, check your inventory.

crate.overflow: You found a **%1$s** while mining, but you had too many and left it behind...
crate.success: You found a %1$s **%2$s** while mining and pick it up. Go and open it with `~>opencrate <crate name>`. You need a crate key, which you can buy using `~>buy key`!

autoequip.success: %1$sAutomatically equipped a **%2$s** on your pick slot.

mine.item_broke_autoequip: *Hint: You can use `~>profile autoequip` and it'll automatically equip the item for you when it breaks, assuming you have one in your inventory.*
mine.waifu_help: Your waifu came and joined your mining adventure and you both get a larger haul!
mine.missing_equipped: %1$sYou had an equipped %2$s pick, but you no longer have any of its kind on your inventory! Equipped pick has been reset.
mine.broken_drop: %1$sYour pick broke, but you can repair it. Got broken item: %2$s *%3$s*
mine.broken_drop_miss: %1$sYour tool broke and you didn't quite manage to get it back.

chop.not_equipped: %1$sYou don't have any equipped axe. Use `~>equip <axe name>` to equip a axe and start your adventure! If you don't have any, first run `~>buy axe`
chop.dust: %1$sThe tree was too brittle and you only got sawdust out of it (Dust level: %2$d%%)

autoequip.success: %1$sAutomatically equipped a **%2$s** on your axe slot.

crate.overflow: You found a **%1$s** while chopping trees, but you had too many already, so we threw it back into the ocean...
crate.success: You found a %1$s **%2$s** while chopping trees and you proceeded to pick it up. Go and open it with `~>opencrate <crate name>`. You need a crate key!

chop.overflow: %1$sYou found some stuff chopping, but you couldn't hold more of some items, so we had to leave some of it away.
chop.success_only_item: %1$sWhile chopping trees, you found %2$s using a *%3$s* and proceed to save them into your inventory.
chop.success: %1$sWhile chopping trees, you found %2$s and **$%3$,d credits** using a *%4$s* and proceed to save them into your inventory.
chop.success_money_noitem: %1$sWhile chopping trees, you found **$%2$,d credits** using a *%3$s* and proceed to save them into your pocket.

errors.amount_not_ticket: %1$sYou cannot specify how many tickets you're gonna use if you're not using tickets!
errors.too_much_money: %1$sThis machine cannot dispense that much money!
errors.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to play the slots machine!
errors.no_tickets: %1$sYou wanted to use tickets but you don't have any :<
errors.no_valid_amount: %1$sThat's not a valid amount of money! (Example of valid amounts: 1000, 1k, 14000)
errors.too_many_tickets: %1$sYou're trying to use too many slot tickets. Maximum allowed is %2$d

slots.roll: %1$s**You used %2$s and rolled the slot machine**
slots.win: And you won **%1$d** credits and got to keep what you bet (%2$d credits)! Lucky!
slots.lose:
And you lost %1$s
I hope you do better next time!

leaderboard.main_page_redirect:
You can see `~>help leaderboard` for a list of available leaderboards.
If you're looking for the money leaderboard, run `~>leaderboard money`

inner.game:
%1sThis page shows the top 10 people who have won the most games.

Check out `~>help game` or `~>help trivia` for details on how games work!
inner.claim:
%1sThis page shows the top 10 people who have been waifu claimed the most.

Check out `~>help waifu` for details on the waifu system.
inner.money_old: %1$sThis page shows the top 10 richest people on Mantaro (before the reset).
inner.money: %1$sThis page shows the top 10 richest people on Mantaro. Grinding is hard!
inner.seasonal_money: %1$sThis page shows the top 10 richest people on Mantaro for this season.
inner.rep: %1sThis page shows the top 10 people with the most reputation.
inner.streak:
%1sThis page shows the top 10 people with the most daily streaks.

Check out `~>help daily` for more info
inner.lvl:
%1sThis page shows the top 10 people with the most level.

Level is earning through talking. Command usage doesn't contribute to experience, and XP has a 30 seconds cooldown.
inner.waifu:
%1sThis page shows the top 10 people with the most weighted waifu value.

Check out `~>help waifu` for details on the waifu system.
inner.gamble:
%1sThis page shows the top 10 people with the most gamble runs won.

Check out `~>help gamble` for details on gamble.
inner.slots:
%1sThis page shows the top 10 people with the most slots runs won.

Check out `~>help slots` for details on slots.

iteminfo.no_content: %1$sYou didn't specify any item to look for! You can search it with emoji or the name.
iteminfo.no_item: %1$sThere's no item matching your search query.

embed.upgrade_content: Click [here](https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Currency-103#tools---getting-an-upgrade) for more information on how to upgrade your tools!

options.error_general:
%1$sIncorrect usage or missing arguments. Make sure the first argument doesn't start with a new line!
If you're lost or want help on using opts, check <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Configuration> for a guide on how to use opts. If you have any issues after reading the wiki, head to <https://support.mantaro.site>

check_data.terminology: **Useful terminology:** [] = empty list, null = not set, {} = empty object. If you see numbers=[...] it means that for that id, it applies what's inside the brackets. Objects are usually comma-separated
check_data.footer: This is a debug command, therefore it's not 100% user-friendly

server_command_disallow.no_command: %1$sYou need to specify the command you want to disable on this server.

server_command_allow.no_command: %1$sYou need to specify the command you want to enable on this server.

server_command_specific_disallow.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify the channel name and the command to disallow.

server_command_specific_allow.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify the channel name and the command to allow.

server_channel_disallow.no_channel: %1$sYou need to specify the channel where you want the bot not to listen to commands.
server_channel_disallow.too_many: %1$sYou cannot disable more channels since the bot wouldn't be able to talk otherwise :(
server_channel_disallow.success: %1$sChannel %2$s will no longer listen to commands.

server_channel_allow.no_channel: %1$sYou need to specify the channel where you want the bot to listen to commands. (All channels by default)

category_disable.no_category: %1$sYou need to specify a category to disable.
category_disable.moderation_notice: %1$sYou cannot disable moderation since it would disable the opts command.

category_enable.no_category: %1$sYou need to specify a category to enable.

category_specific_disable.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify a category to disable and the channel where.
category_specific_disable.moderation_notice: %1$sYou cannot disable moderation since it would disable the opts command.

category_specific_enable.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify a category to enable and the channel where.

server_role_specific_disallow.invalid: %1$sYou need the role and the command to disallow!
server_role_specific_disallow.already_disabled: %1$sThis command was already disabled for the specified role.

server_role_specific_allow.invalid: %1$sYou need the role and the command to allow!
server_role_specific_allow.not_disabled: %1$sThis command wasn't disabled for this role.

category_role_specific_disable.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify a category to disable and the role to.
category_role_specific_disable.moderation_notice: %1$sYou cannot disable moderation since it contains this command.

category_role_specific_enable.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify a role to enable and the channel where.

fairqueue_max.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify a positive integer.
fairqueue_max.success: %1$sSet max fair queue (max duplicated songs) size to %2$d

music_channel.no_channel: %1$sYou need to specify what voice channel you want to bind the music player to.

music_queuelimit.no_args: %1$sYou need to specify what's the queue limit you want to use. *(Default: 350)*
music_queuelimit.success: %1$sThe queue limit on this server is now **%2$d** songs.
music_queuelimit.invalid: %1$sYou're trying to set too high of a number (which won't be applied anyway), silly

music_clearchannel.success: %1$sI can play music on all channels now.

localblacklist_add.invalid: %1$s**You need to specify the users to locally blacklist.**
localblacklist_add.yourself_notice: %1$sWhy are you trying to blacklist yourself?...
localblacklist_add.admin_notice: %1$sOne (or more) of the users you're trying to blacklist are admins or Bot Commanders!
localblacklist_add.bot_notice: %1$sYou can't blacklist a bot. The bot will never reply to any bots.

localblacklist_remove.invalid: %1$s**You need to specify the users to locally un-blacklist.**

logs_enable.no_channel: %1$sYou need to specify which channel to use as the log channel.
logs_enable.success: %1$sMessage logging has been enabled with parameters -> `Channel #%2$s (%3$s)`

logs_exclude.no_args: %1$sYou need to specify which channel to exclude, or `clearchannels` to clear all exceptions, or `remove` to remove a single channel from the exception list.

logs_timezone.not_specified: %1$sYou need to specify a timezone. A valid timezone would be, for example, America/Chicago or GMT-4. A list can be found at <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones> (Use the TZ database name)
logs_timezone.invalid: %1$sNot a valid timezone. A valid timezone would be, for example, America/Chicago or GMT-4. A list can be found at <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones> (Use the TZ database name)
logs_timezone.success: %1$sSet logs timezone to `%2$s`. This timezone will be used to display the time on moderation logs.

birthday_enable.no_args: %1$sYou need to specify the channel name and the role name.
birthday_enable.public_role: %1$sYou cannot set the everyone role as a birthday role! Remember that the birthday role is a role that gets assigned to the person when the birthday comes, and then removes when the day passes away.
birthday_enable.autorole: %1$sYou cannot set the autorole role as a birthday role! Remember that the birthday role is a role that gets assigned to the person when the birthday comes, and then removes when the day passes away.
birthday_enable.warning: %1$sRemember that the birthday role is a role that gets assigned to the person when the birthday comes, and then removes when the day passes away.If you have any doubts on how to configure it, you can always join our support guild and ask. You can also check `~>opts help birthday enable` for an example.
birthday_enable.warning_1: This is because of how the birthday assigner works: It assigns a temporary role to the person having its birthday, and un-assigns it when the birthday day has passed. **This means that everyone with the birthday role will get the role removed the day the birthday passes through**. Please take caution when choosing what role to use, as a misconfiguration might make bad things happen (really)!
birthday_enable.warning_2: The role *has to be a newly created role or a role you don't use for anyone else*. It MUST NOT be a role you already have on your users. Users will need to allow this server to announce their birthday by using `~>birthday allowserver` else their birthday won't appear! Read <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Changes-to-the-birthday-announcement-system> for more info.
birthday_enable.warning_3: Additionally the birthday cache (what is used to store them) is only updated every 23 hours. Meaning if you set your birthday today to tomorrow to test this announcer it will **not** work.
birthday_enable.warning_4: Type **yes** if you agree to set the role %2$s as a birthday role, and **no** to cancel. This timeouts in 45 seconds.
birthday_enable.success: %1$sBirthday logging enabled on this server with parameters -> Channel: `%2$s (%3$s)` and role: `%4$s (%5$s)`
birthday_enable.error_channel_1: %1$sI didn't find a channel or role!
birthday_enable.error_channel_2: *Remember, you don't have to mention neither the role or the channel, rather just type its name, order is <channel> <role>, without the leading "<>".* If the role contains spaces "wrap it in quotes like this"

birthday_disable.success: %1$sBirthday logging has been disabled on this server

explanation.pick: A normal pickaxe you bought on the local market. Seems sturdy enough to mine some stuff.
explanation.diamond_pick: A diamond pick is definitely stronger than the market-bought iron picks I could get on the market, that's for sure!
explanation.comet_pick:
You found some Comet Fragments and realized you could make a Comet Gem out of them.
What did they do? Were they special?
You seemed eager to try it out after being impressed by its glow, so here we are, in your first step towards getting stronger picks.
explanation.star_pick:
Maybe it was the glow, maybe it was the fact they came from a star far away in the galaxy, but it seemed to make for quite a sturdy pick with special properties.
Weird... it seems to attract more gems. Is it the effect of the material, or is it my skill getting better?
explanation.moon_pick:
The moon-like substance mesmerized you.
Was it the fact it glowed like a full moon, or was it the fact it seemed to float on its own?
Regardless, you tried to fuse this with your current pick, and the result was quite satisfactory.
Seems to be a good balance between light and dark, and somehow I mine some gems with it.
Is this really a fragment from a far away moon?
explanation.sparkle_pick:
Something made you look up into the caverns, and you found a sparkly gem on top. Looking up, some fell onto your pick, and it made the pick shine enough to light up the entire cavern.
Quickly, you grab some of the sparkly fragments and get a casting station.
The pick glows bright like the sun... and it seems pretty tough too... how did it fuse so well with iron?
explanation.hellfire_pick:
Reactions between all the elements can be a weird and dangerous process.
Regardless of what your friends told you, you decided to research this topic, and came up with an object brighter than anything you've ever seen...
It seems to be a mix of all the other elements, but it seems quite reactive... it's also quite tough, not much seems to be able to break it...
Have I done good for this world, or have I brought the unknown to life?
explanation.axe: A normal axe you bought on the local market. Good enough to chop some trees down.
explanation.comet_axe: After testing the Comet Fragments on your pick, you also realized you could use them on your axe. It made it stronger, and shinier. All you could wish for.
explanation.star_axe:
A bright glow from a star far away, but in your hands.
Looks like the tree-chopping can continue with this new, shiny axe. You seemed weirded out at first: how can this help me mine more wood?
Well, you soon realized why...
explanation.sparkle_axe:
A touch of sparkle here, a touch of sparkle there!
The axe glows bright like the sun... and it seems pretty tough too... how did it fuse so well with iron?
explanation.moon_axe:
Looking at this axe, you look mesmerized by moon-like glow it emits.
Was it the fact it glowed like a full moon, or was it the fact it seemed to float on its own?
Mesmerized, you cast this substance into your axe and... boom!
The results look good. It seems to chop trees faster, too. Why is it so sharp? Is this really a fragment from a far away moon?
explanation.hellfire_axe:
Reactions between all the elements can be a weird and dangerous process.
You mastered the elements already, and fusing it with your axe now seemed trivial. Maybe it was the glow, maybe it was the fire, but you had to do it.
It works wonders. Nothing can compare. But you're still left wondering whether you really did the right thing.
explanation.rod: A rod you bought at your local fishing market. Looks sturdy.
explanation.comet_rod: After testing the Comet Fragments on your axe, you also realized you could use them on your rod. It made the thread stronger, and it seemed to attract more fish to it. All you could wish for.
explanation.star_rod: The mesmerizing and shiny glow of this fragment could not be overlooked. You fused it together with the thread of your rod, and the fish came flowing through it! Seems like a bait isn't necessary all the time, but it's still useful.
explanation.moon_rod:
You're still impressed by the way this gem floats on it's own. Regardless, you fuse it with the thread of your rod as best as you can. It seems to be a little stronger than a Star Fragment infused rod, but not by much.
Eitherway, you enjoy the glow of it like it's the first day you've ever seen it.
explanation.sparkle_rod:
A touch of sparkle here, a touch of sparkle there!
You pulverized the Sparkle Fragments and coated the thread of your fishing rod with it.
You seem confused. How can this attract fish?
The world has many mysteries, and this is one of them. Maybe it can help you get more credits. Maybe it can bring you satisfaction.
The glow it leaves on the sea is amazing, and you stare at it for hours on end. Maybe you did do the right thing after all.
explanation.hellfire_rod:
Reactions between all the elements can be a weird and dangerous process.
You mastered the elements already, and fusing it with your fishing rod thread now seemed trivial. Maybe it was the glow, maybe it was the fire, but you had to do it.
It works wonders. Fish come in shoals to you. Nothing can compare. But you're still left wondering whether you really did the right thing.
explanation.wrench: A run of the mill wrench you can buy from the market. Useful for repairing items.
explanation.comet_wrench: A Wrench infused with pieces of Comet Gems. Somehow it feels way sturdier.
explanation.sparkle_wrench: A Wrench infused with pieces of Sparkle Fragments. Somehow it feels a lot sturdier.
